hints.content:
We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value. 

Which digit is the largest?

$\maroonD8$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD8$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{8}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD5$.  

  So  $\blueD5$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{8}{,}$$\blueD5$ $\_$ $\_$

The next largest digit is the $\greenD3$.  The $\greenD3$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{8}{,}$$\blueD5$$\greenD3$  $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC2$.  The  $\purpleC2$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{8}{,}\blueD5\greenD3\purpleC2$

The greatest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{8}{,}\blueD5\greenD3\purpleC2$.

question.content:
**Arrange the digits $8, 2, 3,$ and $5$ to create the greatest possible four-digit number.**
